net.myorb.math.matrices

Class Triangular<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.myorb.math.matrices.Triangular<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of component values on which operations are to be executed

    public class Triangular<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    linear equation solutions for triangular matrices
    Author:
    Michael Druckman

        public Vector<T> pivot(Vector<T> v,
                       Vector<T> p)
        permute solution vector to proper order
        Parameters:
        v - the solution vector subject to pivot
        p - the pivot vector coming from LU decomposition process
        Returns:
        the appropriate permutation of solution vector

                      Matrix<T> U,
                      Vector<T> b)
        solve LUx = b
        Parameters:
        L - lower triangular matrix
        U - upper triangular matrix
        b - vector of values forming right side of equation
        Returns:
        vector of x values of solution

                             Matrix<T> t,
                             int i,

        set an element of the result
        Parameters:
        v - the vector of results being collected
        t - the triangular matrix being used for solution
        i - the row number of the element
        j - the column number

      • luXb

        public Vector<T> luXb(Matrix<T> L,
                      Matrix<T> U,
                      Vector<T> b,
                      Vector<T> p)
        allow for additional pivot step
        Parameters:
        L - lower triangular matrix
        U - upper triangular matrix
        b - vector of values forming right side of equation
        p - an additional pivot vector for solution permutation
        Returns:
        vector of x values of solution

        Parameters:

        to - the destination result vector
        Returns:

        use previous row sums to compute next x
        Parameters:
        sum - the sum of previous x values with coefficients
        i - the current row number
        t - the triangular matrix
        b - the solution vector
        v - the result vector
